name: 1. Project Overview
content:
Healthcare Insurance Claims Analytics


Objective:

Healthcare Insurance Claims Analytics revolves around a sample Insurance Claims dataset. The objective is to predict and identify possible fraudulent claims submissions. Once identified Claims would be further analyzed to validate the claims requested.


Approach:

  • Utilize the H2O Distributed Random Forest machine learning model for classification.
  • Apply data analysis techniques to pre-process and explore the transaction dataset.
  • Develop a predictive model for churn classification.


Significance:

  • Improve the efficiency of the claim settlement process.
  • Identifies the fraudulent claims thus minimizing the loss incurred.


Expected Outcomes:

  • Accurate predictions of fraudulent claims to improve Insurance Claim Process efficiency.
  • Various insights depicting distribution across various dimensions such as Claims distribution by Organization, Providers, and by geographical locations.


This project employs the H2O Distributed Random Forest classification model to address the customer churn classification challenge, utilizing advanced analytics and machine learning methodologies. The application of Random Forest aims to provide accurate predictions and contribute to the optimization of the identification of fraudulent claims.
